notes.text:
An update for openshift-enterprise-console-container is now
available for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which
gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from
the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hat's cloud computing
Kubernetes application platform solution designed for on-premise or private
cloud deployments.

This advisory contains the openshift-enterprise-container container
image for Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.16.

Security Fix(es):

* atomic-openshift: CSRF tokens not refreshing while user is logged in and are exposed in the URL (CVE-2019-10176)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE
page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: OpenShift Container Platform 4.1.16 security and bug fix update

full_product_name.name: openshift4/ose-console@sha256:7fc260b14d4abcd49a804b09250a68c4dc6559eb05f5abc99b8f95224a039597_amd64 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4.1

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: A flaw was found in OpenShift Container Platform, versions 3.11 and later, in which the CSRF tokens used in the cluster console component were found to remain static during a user's session. An attacker with the ability to observe the value of this token would be able to re-use the token to perform a CSRF attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: atomic-openshift: CSRF tokens not refreshing while user is logged in and are exposed in the URL
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: OpenShift Container Platform versions prior to 3.11 do not contain the affected "cluster console" component and are not vulnerable to this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.1 see the following documentation, which
will be updated shortly for release 4.1.16, for important instructions on
how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this asynchronous errata
update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.1/release_notes/ocp-4-1-release-notes.html
